dublinCore.dc:title: 116 HR 1550 IH: Jobs and Opportunities for SNAP Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. LaTurner (for himself, Mr. Jackson of Texas, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, and Mr. Guest) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to restore and standardize work requirements for able-bodied adults enrolled in the supplemental nutrition assistance program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Jobs and Opportunities for SNAP Act.

section.header: Restoring the work requirement for able-bodied adults without dependents in the supplemental nutrition assistance program
section.text: Section 2301 of the Families First Coronavirus Response Act (Public Law 116–127; 7 U.S.C. 2011 note) is repealed.

section.header: Standardizing work requirements for able-bodied adults in the supplemental nutrition assistance program
section.text: Section 6(o)(3) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2015(o)(3)) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: Paragraph (2) shall not apply to an individual if the individual is—

subparagraph.text: under 18 or over 65 years of age;
medically certified as physically or mentally unfit for employment;
a parent or other member of a household with responsibility for a dependent child under 7 years of age;

section.header: Standardizing enforcement of work requirements in the supplemental nutrition assistance program
section.text: Section 6(o)(4) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2015(o)(4)) is repealed.

section.header: Reforming work requirement exemptions in the supplemental nutrition assistance program
section.text: Section 6(o)(6) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2015(o)(6)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (E) by striking 12 percent and inserting 3 percent, and
in subparagraph (G) by inserting that begins before the date of the enactment of the America Works Act of 2023 after year the 2d place it appears.

section.text: Section 16(h)(1))(E)(ii) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2025(h)(1)(E)(ii) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subclause (II) by adding and at the end,
